alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 1:39PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Cleburne and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ranburne, Woodland, Newell, Graham and Trickem.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
